docs.lead_paragraph: This month Pfizer's chief executive, Jeffrey B. Kindler, held a breakfast for venture capitalists atop a hotel in San Francisco. Some guests took it as a sign that Pfizer was serious about buying young biotechnology companies or licensing their technology.

headline.main: Wyeth Deal May Slow Pfizer Biotech Acquisitions

docs.abstract: This month Pfizer's chief executive, Jeffrey B. Kindler, held a breakfast for venture capitalists atop a hotel in San Francisco. Some guests took it as a sign that Pfizer was serious about buying young biotechnology companies or licensing their technology. But Pfizer's deal to buy a big pharmaceuticals rival, Wyeth, raises questions about how willing [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: After announcing the $68 billion megamerger with Wyeth on Monday morning, Pfizer's chief executive, Jeffrey B. Kindler, did not have much time to celebrate.

headline.main: For Pfizer, a Big Deal and a Test

docs.abstract: After announcing the $68 billion megamerger with Wyeth on Monday morning, Pfizer's chief executive, Jeffrey B. Kindler, did not have much time to celebrate. There was too much gloomy news to deal with. The companies' combined work force of 128,000 will shed 19,000 jobs. Pfizer will slash its stock dividend in half. And Pfizer is [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Pfizer’s plan to buy Wyeth may pack a nasty side effect for the New York region, in the form of layoffs and the likely shuttering of one company’s headquarters.

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists are systematically following children exposed to cocaine before birth and the findings suggest that the long-term effects may be relatively small.

docs.lead_paragraph: With little public debate, Medicare has expanded its coverage for cancer treatments lacking F.D.A. approval.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal government ruled that New York cannot grant couples the same income protections when the sick spouse receives at-home care instead of a nursing home.

docs.lead_paragraph: China announced Wednesday that it intends to spend $123 billion by 2011 to establish universal health care for the country’s 1.3 billion people.
